main event: A blue-white, oblong object approximately 100 feet in length was observed maneuvering erratically over West Virginia.
interesting points: The object passed directly over the observer before moving off and disappearing.
The object was estimated to be approximately 3 miles above sea level.
The observation lasted for 415 seconds (about 6 minutes and 55 seconds).
The report concluded that the object was most likely a meteorological phenomenon passing through the Earth's atmosphere and burning up.
The report also considered the possibility that the object could have been a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical phenomenon.
sighted object: blue-white, oblong object approximately 100 feet in length
location: 3 miles west of St. Albans, West Virginia
